topic.title: Introduction: Why Anonymity Matters
topic.body:
"Give a man a mask and he'll tell you the truth." --Oscar Wilde

Excerpt from my book "The Ultimate Guide to Anonymity" (Copyright 2019.)

So, “why is anonymity so important,” some of you may be
asking. Anonymity is of importance for many reasons, but let’s start
with the fact that it is a basic human right. The Supreme Court of
the United States of America has actually tied the right to be
anonymous to the First Amendment right to free speech and
association which reads, “Congress shall make no law respecting an
establishment of religion, or prohibiting the free exercise thereof; or
abridging the freedom of speech, or of the press; or the right of the
people peaceably to assemble, and to petition the government for a
redress of grievances.” You have the right to speak freely which
covers speaking anonymously, and freedom of the press means
reporters are free to do so in anonymous fashion.
It is important to protect anonymity under the law as without
such protection individuals who are working toward promoting
social progress may face potential ramifications such as stalking,harassment, difficulty finding employment, and even threats against
their life. Also, the right to privacy is guaranteed as a basic human
right under international law. This is reflected in Article 12 of the
Universal Declaration of Human Rights which states, “No one shall
be subjected to arbitrary interference with his privacy, family, home
or correspondence, nor to attacks upon his honour and reputation.
Everyone has the right to the protection of the law against such
interference or attacks.” Without our right to be anonymous, social
progress would stagnate and civilization as a whole would greatly
suffer as a result.

topic.title: The Pyramid Code
topic.body:
A friend of mine asked me to help her preserve this content as the work's original publisher feels in may be taken down by YouTube in the future, and so naturally I uploaded a copy of it to KopyKate BIG. I am asking for all of you assistance in seeding this file, and if you are interested please listen and leave a nice review here! Thank you all very much!

"Imagine living in a world without time and space, without walls, without borders, without wars, without disease, without vaccines, without toxins, without drugs, and without doctors. A world of Love, brotherhood, and harmony. A world of happiness, wealth, eternal abundance and equality. A world without a false religion and a fake book of laws that controls us. A world in which we are the law itself. A world of justice. A world without false rabbis, false priests, or any other corrupt religious leaders. A world without corrupt lawyers, judges or politicians. It is doable. It has already happened and it will happen again!" --The Pyramid Code

1598581805_1BfrmacRWaPSuHVmRdvaMUYykqd2M.body:
Wow, this is rather interesting to say the least lmfao!

I am _definitely_ not conspiring with kapec, nofish, zaron, or geekless in any way. There are many aspects of this that seem to interest me from the psychological aspect of how conspiracy theories work and are formed, but I (again) would like to assure the public that this is entirely baseless. I would never side with people who make threats of deanonymizing persons as this goes against my morals, and I would also never side with people who seek censorship of a platform designed for free speech. So, let's get that cleared up first off.

Second off, let's say some aspects of the conspiracy are true. The same thing has happened with QAnon and Donald Trump which has now successfully resulted in the proper authorities taking action against the underlying injustices emphasized by the QAnon conspiracy theory. So, again, if it is true that I am using alter egos then perhaps that is for the same reason. It draws attention to my cause and it entices people such as Kapec to even further promote it.

"Propaganda works best when those who are being manipulated are confident they are acting on their own free will."  --Joseph Goebbels (Hitler’s Minister of Propaganda)

People cannot accept that propaganda works when they cannot accept that propaganda works on them.

To believe yourself above the influence of propaganda, is to become more susceptible to propaganda.

1603738395_1Dr4Ji2TmsvhJW383ukksrobMvEwJ.body:
> [bigbadbob](#comment_1176_1CLhLYdMKjXtium9yjuRkSnFvPfdoUTXAj): Doesn't social media kinda defeat the purpose of TOR?

Not necessarily. Social Network Analysis, Stylometrics, etc can be used to ID the users of social media sites over Tor, but being mindful of such and it would be nearly impossible to positively ID all users of said service.

Social Networking via Tor allows for elimination of censorship such as that in China, Russia, and the United States for example. It is the reason the United States' Supreme Court ruled that Anonymity is protected under the First Amendment. Anonymity is the only way to speak in the United States sometimes for various reasons for example.

> [kapec](#comment_76_1CQ14MAUEp55ijU6rQLQ9vZdzxCQe9s1SF): same could be said about encryption and knowledge-sharingyet DMCA and Encryption export restrictions still happened1st amendment is a joke at this point

Eh, I wouldn't say it is a joke per se. Though you are right about how encryption and knowledge sharing are an infringement upon the people's civil liberties that were once necessary during wartime which no longer serve their intended purpose and are in a sense easily circumvented anyway.

Further, I do agree with you that very many "laws" have been put forth that conflict with the constitutional rights of the American people which is why we have the Supreme Court and Common Law to help protect us here.

The Supreme Court has made poor judgement calls in the past though, and so there has also recently been an uptick in the number of people interested in an International Court of Laws. These rights are guaranteed under international law and protected by the United Nations. An example of such can be seen here: https://www.commonlawcourt.com/

Also, here: https://www.itnj.org/

Many more examples can be found here as well: https://www.un.org/securitycouncil/content/repertoire/international-tribunals

#WeThePeople
